Extractors#

PDF content extraction backends.

Protocol#

class papercutter.extractors.base.Extractor[source]#

Protocol defining the interface for PDF extraction backends.

extract_text(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract text from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extract all pages.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Extracted text as a string.

extract_tables(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract tables from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extract from all pages.

Return type:

list[dict[str, Any]]

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing table data and metadata.

get_page_count(path)[source]#

Get the number of pages in the PDF.

Parameters:

path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

int

Returns:

Number of pages.

extract_text_by_page(path, pages=None)[source]#

Extract text from PDF, returning per-page results.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers. If None, extract all pages.

Return type:

list[tuple[int, str]]

Returns:

List of (page_number, text) tuples where page_number is 0-indexed.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)#

Backends#

PdfPlumber (default)

class papercutter.extractors.pdfplumber.PdfPlumberExtractor[source]#

PDF extraction backend using pdfplumber library.

__init__(max_workers=None)[source]#

Initialize the extractor.

Parameters:

max_workers (Optional[int]) – Maximum number of worker processes for parallel extraction. Defaults to min(4, cpu_count) to avoid overwhelming the system.

extract_text(path, pages=None, parallel=False)[source]#

Extract text from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extract all pages.

  • parallel (bool) – Use parallel processing for large documents. Automatically enabled for documents with 10+ pages.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Extracted text as a string.

Raises:

  • InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

  • ExtractionError – If text extraction fails.

extract_tables(path, pages=None, parallel=False)[source]#

Extract tables from PDF.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers to extract. If None, extract from all pages.

  • parallel (bool) – Use parallel processing for large documents. Automatically enabled for documents with 10+ pages.

Returns:

  • page: 0-indexed page number

  • data: 2D list of cell values

  • bbox: Bounding box tuple (x0, y0, x1, y1)

Return type:

List of dictionaries containing

Raises:

  • InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

  • ExtractionError – If table extraction fails.

get_page_count(path)[source]#

Get the number of pages in the PDF.

Parameters:

path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

int

Returns:

Number of pages.

Raises:

InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

extract_text_by_page(path, pages=None, parallel=False)[source]#

Extract text from PDF, returning per-page results.

Parameters:

  • path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • pages (Optional[list[int]]) – Optional list of 0-indexed page numbers. If None, extract all pages.

  • parallel (bool) – Use parallel processing for large documents. Automatically enabled for documents with 10+ pages.

Return type:

list[tuple[int, str]]

Returns:

List of (page_number, text) tuples where page_number is 0-indexed.

Raises:

  • InvalidPDFError – If the PDF cannot be opened.

  • ExtractionError – If text extraction fails.

PyMuPDF (fast) - pip install papercutter[fast]

Set via: PAPERCUTTER_EXTRACTION__BACKEND=pymupdf
